individualCoinsDetails.footerLendingMessageContent: Lending is the process of temporarily loaning your coins to different borrowers on the blockchain in return for interest payments. Let's make sure you're

prequalification.goodfit: It looks like your investor profile is a good fit for Managed Portfolios!
prequalification.nextstep: The next step is to take a Risk Assessment so that we can learn more about your individual investing preferences.
prequalification.faqAccBody1: An individualâ€™s net worth is calculated as an individualâ€™s total assets minus total liabilities. Assets include but are not limited to: real estate, equity and fixed income investments, private company securities, vehicles, annuities and insurance, cash and cash equivalents, and other property that can be valued and converted to cash. Money in your bank account, retirement savings, and any personal property that you own are included as part of your net worth. Liabilities include all outstanding debt borne by the individual.
prequalification.faqAccBody2: The primary residence is not counted as an asset in the net worth calculation. The term â€œprimary residenceâ€ is commonly understood to mean the home where a person lives the most of the time.
prequalification.faqAccBody3: In general, debt secured by the primary residence (such as a mortgage or home equity line of credit) is not counted as a liability in the net worth calculation if the estimated fair market value of the residence is greater than the amount of debt secured by it.
prequalification.faqAccBody4: However, if the amount of debt secured by the residence has increased in the 60 days preceding the sale of securities to the investor (other than in connection with the acquisition of the primary residence), then the amount of that increase is included as a liability in the net worth calculation, even if the estimated value of the residence is greater than the amount of debt secured by it. The purpose of this provision is to deter individuals from incurring debt secured by their primary residence for the purpose of inflating their net worth to qualify as accredited investors in purchasing securities.
prequalification.faqAccBody5: If the amount of debt secured by the primary residence is greater than the estimated fair market value of the residence, then the excess is included as a liability in the net worth calculation. Where the amount of secured debt is greater than the value of the primary residence, such as when a mortgage is â€œunderwater,â€ the excess is counted as a liability when calculating net worth.
prequalification.faqAccBody7: Individuals and entities can qualify as an Accredited Investor. For the purpose of this memo, the focus will be on the individual. Individuals may qualify as accredited investors based on income and wealth thresholds, or if professional criteria are met.
prequalification.faqAccBody8: An individual qualifies as an accredited investor if the individual:
prequalification.faqAccBody9: Possesses a net worth of over $1 million, excluding primary residence. This threshold can be met on an individual basis or with a spouse or partner.
prequalification.faqAccBody10: Reports gross income of over $200,000(individually) or $300,000(with spouse or partner) in each of the prior two years, and reasonably expects the same for the current year.
prequalification.faqAccBody11: Is an investment professional in good standing holding the general securities representative license(Series 7), the investment adviser representative license(Series 65), or the private securities offerings representative license(Series 82).
prequalification.faqAccBody12: Is a director, executive officer, or a general partner(GP) of a company selling securities(or of a GP of that company).
prequalification.faqAccBody13: Is a "family client" of a "family office" that qualifies as an accredited investor.
prequalification.faqAccBody14: Is a "knowledgeable employee" of a(private) investment fund.
prequalification.faqIncomeBody1: Employment is the condition of having paid work. Employed persons have an agreement with another party to render labor services and receive payment in return.
prequalification.faqIncomeBody3: Income is money received from work, government assistance or the sale of investments. Household income is the combined income of a group of people living together.
prequalification.faqNetworthBody1: Liquid net worth is the amount of money a person owns in cash or cash equivalents, minus the liabilities or debt that they owe. Money in checking and savings accounts as well as marketable securities in taxable accounts are included as part of your liquid net worth. Liabilities like mortgages and credit card debt are subtracted from your liquid net worth.
prequalification.faqExperienceSubtitle: What is considered experience investing in crypto assets?
prequalification.faqExperienceBody1: Purchasing Bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies as well as NFTs are considered investments in crypto assets.
prequalification.faqAInvestingBody1: Investors should enter into an investment with a goal in mind so they can track their progress and make sound investment decisions. Investors typically intend to earn a profit from their investments, but the time horizon should also be considered. An investor with a goal of saving for retirement should act differently than one who intends to make short term gains.
prequalification.attentionWarning:
Given your current employment status and income, 
 the most you can invest is ${{value}}.
